Posts.Content: Mar 26, 2013 06:12PM pepper1973 wrote: Awesome, I got some great info and have an appointment set up for next month.  So quick question and I hope I don't sound over the top narotic, but I am thinking it's a cyst and obviously the best way to find out for sure is to get it checked by a professional but is there any good ideas on how to maybe get rid of it before I go in?  I've been heating it with a hot compress trying to make it work itself out, I just really hate hate hate hate going to the doctors and if it isn't serious I don't want to take the place of someone that really has something critical going on. I'm just curious if there is any at home remedies to help the swelling or completely get rid of it. I just have the strangest feeling about this and want it gone. And so if I try to naturally heal it and it doesn't go away, then I could feel better about going in...I know sounds a little wacky.
Posts.Title: Where do I start? No insurance. pepper1973 pepper1973

Posts.Content: pepper1973 wrote: I don't want hit the panic button, and I am sure it's just a cyst, but all of a sudden yesterday was laying on my side and felt what feels almost like a finger poking my arm. Very strange feeling, being that it was coming from my boob. When self examining further it feels like thumb sitting on top of my implant...yes there are implants from 10+ years ago. Is this something that should really be looked at in the first place, do I need to be worried? And if so where would I even start?   Oncotype DX 42 Dx 4/11/2013, IDC, Left, 1cm, Stage IB, Grade 3, 0/1 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Surgery 5/10/2013 Mastectomy: Left Chemotherapy 6/20/2013 Cytoxan (cyclophosphamide), Taxotere (docetaxel) Radiation Therapy 9/20/2013 Breast, Lymph nodes Hormonal Therapy 1/3/2014 Surgery 6/10/2014 Reconstruction (left); Reconstruction (right) Dx 2/18/2019, Stage IV, metastasized to bone/liver/lungs, Grade 3, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Where do I start? No insurance. pepper1973 pepper1973

Posts.Content: May 28, 2013 09:42PM pepper1973 wrote: I need some help. 1 mm margin, now suggesting radiation after chemo. I put the emphasis on suggesting, because I don't want to do this at all.  I was aggressive enough by having a mastectomy so why do they want to do radiation on me now? Should I get a second opinion? Also what does this mean as far as my chemo plan.  We were only going to do the 2 drugs v. 3 only 9 weeks instead of 5 months.  But after having my drain out the other day my surgeon said that the whole treatment plan may change now because of the margins...Also, with it being on my left the radiation oncologist said that I will have to learn a breathing trick that brings my heart down and to the right.  This is why I chose to do the mast instead of lumpectomy. Am I now going to be subjected to heart issues. UGGGHHHH!!! Really need some advice here.
